Balraj Goulikar wrote:
> 
> Hi all,
> Can JUnit be used for testing with Spring framework with hibernate? or
> do we require HttpUnit or JUnitEE for this?

You should really read Rod Johnson's book, the one in which he develops 
Spring. That will show you just how well Spring is suited to testing via 
JUnit.

HttpUnit/HtmlUnit/XhtmlUnit/jWebUnit all help you test the web UI (or 
the application through the web UI, which is discouraged).

I don't know JUnitEE that well; I prefer Cactus. It is good for testing 
on the server side.

But Spring is really built to wire together plain Java classes, so you 
should be able to test 99% of your application without knowing about 
Spring at all.

> i have to test stored procedures called from hibernate persisters over
> spring framework.

Ignore everything except the stored procedures. To test those, you can 
use something like DbUnit and call the stored procedures from JDBC.

If you're worried that the persistent classes aren't invoking the right 
stored procedures, or aren't passing the right parameters, test that 
/without/ actually invoking the stored procedure. (How to do that is 
homework for you.)

Either way, put Spring out of your mind for these tests. Spring wraps 
your classes, and those classes shouldn't know Spring is there.

> Let me know if anything else can be applied for unit testing this.

There are a few good books on the topic. I'll let you guess which one I 
recommend.
